event.name: START_BEACON_ANCIENT
event.text: You pull yourself off the floor, in a daze. The ship cameras show most of the other crew doing the same, waking from their slumber. The only one who seems unfazed is Aenwithe, who hastens to check on you. "We've made it okay, but now we have a few things to be careful of. Though I doubt the Rebels will be able to follow us for now, they will catch up eventually if they truly are tracking you as you suspect. Additionally, it is very likely that this sector is protected by a guard ship. If so, I doubt they'll let us through unharmed."
As warned, there appears to be an Obelisk Guard here. As soon as your ship moves within proximity of it, the ship lights up and its weapons activate.

choice.text: Hail them, maybe you can get through this without conflict?

event.text: "Flesh beings, you dare enter our divine plane? This place is not meant for creatures of blood and mortal soul! Your extermination shall be swift yet merciless. May you pests be ridden of from this galaxy!" Well, so much for nonviolence, get ready for a one hell of a fight!

event.name: GUARD_ANCIENT_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Obelisk guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_ANCIENT_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Obelisk guard. Without crew on board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: FLEET_ROYAL_SELITE
event.text: It appears Vance's fleet has caught up to you at last. An MFK Ace ship moves forward, brandishing its weapons and ready to kill.

choice.text: (Adv. Engines) Try to escape the elite.

event.name: START_BEACON_ROYAL
event.text: This time, you found yourself at least leaning against a wall. Most of the other crew did better as well, and as always Aenwithe is completely unfazed. "We're here. Fortunately, the resistance has managed to take out the guard already and blockade the sector. Now, let's get this bomb built."

You dock with one of the nearby Obelisk ships, which Aenwithe assures you has been captured by his people already. You're introduced to several other Obelisks who look identical to each other with various names you cannot pronounce. Aenwithe looks around, as if looking for someone, but cannot seem to find them.

Aenwithe ignores you, but talks to one of the other Obelisks. "Where is E?" The Obelisk responds, "She was taken by the Queen. The Royals heard of her betrayal, and there was little we could do. Their Dreadnaught is back online..."

choice.text: Who is E? And there's a second Dreadnaught?

event.name: ROYAL_MFK_ARRIVAL
event.text: Aenwithe pauses, and you assume he would have sighed had he had lungs. "E is the princess of the Obelisk Royals. Don't mind the single letter name, that's just how the Royals name themselves. For simplicity, I guess. Or maybe the memes? Anyways, doesn't matter. E is the only Royal amongst our resistance, and the only person who can build the bomb. But now she's been taken. Even worse, the Royals do in fact have an even stronger Dreadnaught, protecting Liythkyk Yuk, their capital."

Suddenly, an alarm in the fleet ship goes off. A squadron of MFK fleet ships jump in, immediately opening fire on the Obelisks. Aenwithe curses, "Damn it, the Rebels got through! It was only a matter of time. We need to evacuate immediately! We'll regroup at the palace and rescue E, finish this bomb, then purge this entire sector to its core!"
As you're leaving, an MFK Gunboat Ace stops you. "You're that... that Multiverse Renegade that led us here! You die today, Federation scum!"

event.name: ROYAL_MFK_DEFEAT
event.text: You receive one last message from the Rebel captain as the ship dies, "God... damn you. You might survive today, but Vance will catch you soon enough, and he'll make your lives hell..." With the ship neutralized, you scrap the remains.

With the Gunboat out of the way, there doesn't appear to be any other ships around that aren't already occupied and able to fight you. In this short grace period, Aenwithe speaks again, "Good, we must hurry to Liythkyk Yuk and rescue E. Be careful, now we don't only have the Royals to deal with, but the Rebels too."

event.name: ANCIENT_CACHE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the Ancient cache.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Location of the Ancient cache.

event.text: You have arrived at the cache. You can see the Dreadnaught looming in the distance, though it is too far away to make out its features. As expected, it would be impossible to access the cache, which resembles a gigantic vault sculpted into the side of a planet, without eliminating the ship.

Aenwithe observes the Dreadnaught, seemingly unafraid. "Big ship. But still nothing compared to the ones you'll see in the Homeworlds. Let this be a test to see if we're ready for what's to come. Worst case, we die. No big deal."
You power up your weapons and move in to destroy the ship. Its shadow blocks out the light through your windows as it descends upon you, ready to reduce you to dust.

event.name: ANCSECTOR_DREAD_AI
event.text: All of the crew aboard the Dreadnaught are dead, but the ship keeps fighting. There must be some sort of AI mode attached to it!

event.name: ANCSECTOR_PART_4
event.text: "You've done it. The Dreadnaught is dead! This is beyond incredible. You flimsy mortal creatures may not be so pathetic after all. All that's left is to grab the parts and destroy the Cache." You promise to do so, but scrap the Dreadnaught first.

It takes a few tries to get the vault door open, but once you manage to bust a hole in the side, a brilliant light shines through. Inside is a gigantic cavern, filled with ships, repair drones, weapons, and supplies. A few things catch your eye, including the largest ship present, a Cruiser you suspect.

You set up many explosives around the vault to explode all at once, and exit as fast as possible. You put a safe distance between yourself and the cache, and watch the fireworks. If you can defeat the Flagship as well, you'll have saved reality twice!

event.name: VAULT_DESTROYED
event.text: As you're preparing to leave, a squadron of Obelisk ships approaches, drawn in by the explosion. They're led by a Royal ship, whose captain hails you. "You... You have destroyed the cache. You filthy mortal insect, you will suffer for this!" You shrug, and flick the weapons in their direction. None of the Obelisk squadron dares mess with the ship that killed the Dreadnaught, and so they quickly jump away, presumably to the homeworlds to spread the news of your approach.

Aenwithe is very pleased. "Do not worry about the fleet, the Homeworlds are already on high alert anyways. We must move quickly, we need to head to our base and construct the bomb! We will head to the Homeworlds directly. Grab hold of something again, and try not to black out."

event.name: ROYAL_PALACE

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: The location of the Ancient Palace.
beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Location of the Ancient Palace.

event.text: You have arrived at Liythkyk Yuk. Below your ship is a vast cityscape with massive cruisers moving back and forth. It's so green... probably too green. But that doesn't matter, hopefully you won't be here too long.

You pilot closer to the surface, and for a brief moment you almost think you can get through this without a fight. However, any hopes of this are immediately dashed when the Royal Dreadnaught Aenwithe mentioned appears from the sky, moving closer with clear intent to kill. "Mortal invaders! Your filth shall be purged from our realm!" Looks like it's time for one more battle, and hopefully the last you'll ever have.

event.name: ROYAL_PALACE_SUCCESS
event.text: As the Dreadnaught comes crashing down into the Royal Palace, you can't help but think to yourself how nice it would be to never see one of these damn Obelisks ever again. You dismount from the ship followed by Aenwithe, who stops and says "Well, best get out your reading glasses if you need them, there's a lot of text ahead." You aren't sure what that really means, but it is probably good advice to heed.

You consider not bothering to scrap the Dreadnaught, but that's just not how you do things. With the Dreadnaught destroyed, you should have some time to clear out any remaining intruders then make your way to the palace.

event.name: ROYAL_PALACE_ENTER
event.text: Not a single ship bothers you as you walk into the palace. An advanced Cognitive shouts as you enter, "Hey! You can't be in her-" but you promptly silence it with a single shot. You'd be fine without seeing any more Cognitives either, quite frankly. You continue your way through the palace.

Once you've made it to the Royal Chambers, you look to Aenwithe for directions. "Yes yes, to the right we go." You follow him into E's chambers, where you find an Obelisk Royal studying several blueprints on holographic screens floating around the room. "So, you finally showed up? About time. And do be careful, the Obelisk Queen is behind you."

You spin around to see the Obelisk Queen, with 2 Atomizer drones on either side, facing you. "You've come this far, just to build this damn bomb of yours? You mortals really have a lot of dedication. I'd almost admire it, but that would mean I'd have to actually LIKE something about you. Anyways, now I'm going to kill you, so I hope this was all worth it in the end."

choice.text: Threaten to detonate the Paragon right now.

event.text: "What? That bomb isn't even armed! You think I'm stupid? Now, no more delays, you're going to di-" The Queen doesn't get time to finish, because a missile flies into the wall, destroying the side and sending everyone in the room backwards from the shockwave. The Paragon spins and slides towards the hole, where you can see the outline of what appears to be... another Flagship?!

The stocky build of a muscular and imposing man with two heavy duty blasters holstered at his hip materializes, presumably from a teleporter aboard the Flagship. You recognize him almost immediately as Admiral Vance of the Rebel fleet himself, with a smug grin on his face. "What's this about a bomb?" Vance bends over and picks up the Paragon. "I have to say, you've done me a great service putting this thing together. Sure, it's not complete just yet, but I have confidence with some scans we can figure it out."

Vance paces the room, one hand gripping the bomb and the other reaching for his gun. "For years now, I have been searching for this damned thing. When my men first uncovered the Multiverse Drive, we didn't yet understand the scale of the cosmic goose chase we'd be stuck in for... well probably a good century or so by now! At least, from my perspective. Micro-cloning and stasis sleep can keep you ticking for years, but you better not be a vain person, because aging has its... effects. It certainly has on me."

"Now then, enough monologuing." Vance quickly draws his gun and shoots the Obelisk Queen thrice, each shot piercing her chassis and disabling her completely. "There, the Queen is dead, and the Royals will fall. This bomb has a special date with an old friend of mine, so if you don't mind, I shall take my leave. Glory to the Rebellion." Vance salutes then warps away back to the Flagship, which slowly makes its ascent from the planet.

You quickly regroup with your crew, whose newest member now includes E herself, back at your ship. What's most worrying isn't Vance's sudden arrival, but what he said. If he knows what the Paragon is, then it's presumable he'll know how to construct and detonate it too. Even worse, as you watch the Flagship jump away, an advanced analysis of his MV drive shows he has one particular reality in mind - Universe 0, the first reality and home to the Federation's Multiverse fleet. If Vance can get there, he can wipe out that entire reality, damning the entire Federation across all realities!

There's no other choice left. You must pursue Vance while you can, and put a stop to him before he can fulfill his master plans. You set your FTL drive to the same trajectory as him, and get ready for one hell of a fight.

event.name: ANCIENT_DUPLICATOR
event.text: At first you think this is just a regular beacon, until you notice the giant moon sized machine built here. You spot a hangar area for ships to dock, though it appears empty.

The protective shield around the hangar lowers automatically as you approach, then seals once again when you're inside. You step outside your ship only to realize something very strange. The room is filled with oxygen, something uncharacteristic for Obelisk structures.
An automated language speaks to you. "Hello travelers. Welcome to the Quantum Item Replicator. Please insert items you wish to duplicate into the slot on the wall to your left."
You push 5 fuel cells into the slot and wait.
You push 5 missiles into the slot and wait.
You push 5 drone parts into the slot and wait.

choice.text: (Phantom Crew) Your Ghost eagerly begs to be put into the machine.

event.text: You shrug and force the Ghost into the machine. It doesn't protest as it slips into the tiny slot and falls down a large hole into the pits of the machine.

After a little while a strange noise can be heard coming from the second, much larger hole to your right. Your Ghost pops back out, followed by a second larger Ghost. The two Ghosts seem overly excited, and you decide not to ask what happened inside the machine.

event.name: ANCIENT_USELESS_WEAPON
event.text: An agitated Obelisk hails you. "You, mortal one. We have an issue with this strange device. It's a weapon of sorts, but we can't figure out how to operate it."

You try to explain the Obelisks how to mount weapons to their ship, but they cut you off. "No no, we know how to do that. The tech in this thing... it's so modern, and too simple. We have no use for it, you can have it."
"Bah, just a useless flesh-being. Nothing significant about you."

event.name: ANCIENT_LOST_DUDE
event.text: To your surprise, a hibernating Obelisk is simply drifting in space.
The Obelisk never once stirs. For all you know, it will continue to drift powerless for centuries after you leave.
You pull the Obelisk aboard your ship. Almost immediately, it lights up. "Oh how marvelous, you've found me. I thought I would be stuck in the empty vaccuum of space forever."

At first the Obelisk doesn't stir, and you consider stashing it in the storage for later. But as you begin to move it, it suddenly activates and fires a laser which destroys your shields! You draw your blaster, but the Obelisk has already calmed down. "Oh, my bad. Truly sorry about your equipment. I hope you don't mind if I request to join your crew? It's been terribly boring drifting in space for eternity, and I'd like some action for once."

event.name: ANCIENT_DESIRE
event.text: A voice booms over your intercom, speaking slowly. "Aliens, here? How curious. This is a chance too good to pass up. Do not resist, I have taken control over your entire vessel. Tell me, what do you desire most?"
"Money, the means for which to obtain all that the universe may offer. Take this gift my friend, I hope it brings you all that you desire."

"Ahhh, what a vain desire. Ever since we shed our organic forms in favor of these mechanical bodies, we have forgotten the pursuits of lust or beauty. Unfortunately, I cannot alter your form myself. I can however gift you a truly beautiful creature for you to reflect upon."
"Don't we all. I hope you forgive me that I am going to take this literally, but perhaps you'll find some humor in it. Best of luck in your pursuits, mortal."
The Obelisk breaks into a fit of laughter. "Oh, how so absolutely stupid and ignorant of you. Oh, but whatever. Here, have this. I think you'll find its irony quite entertaining, as I sure do."
"The foolish creature hopes to break free? Did you not hear my warning? I am in control of your ship. Answer my question or suffer the consequences. What is it you desire most?"
"Money, the means for which to obtain all that the universe may offer. Take this gift my friend, I hope it brings you all that you desire."

choice.text: Resist again and suffer the consequences.

event.text: "Then you deserve all that is coming to you."

choice.text: (Anti-Virus) Restore your systems and fight back.

event.text: Your Anti-Virus struggles to counter the Obelisk tech. It manages to restore just a few of the critical systems.

event.name: ROYAL_ZOO
event.text: For once, a Royal ship in the same system as you isn't looking to fight... at least not immediately. Instead, they hail you with an offer. "I am a collector, and I fancy to study some of the more exotic races of your mortal plane. Please, come aboard, maybe you'll find one of my collections you'd like for your own, or perhaps you'd be willing to give me one of yours for healthy compensation!"
You're wary of a trap, but no attack comes yet. You find several cages containing various strange creatures, some more foreign than others.

choice.text: Offer to buy one of his collections.
Offer to sell one of your more exotic crew.

event.text: "Yes! Who might you have for me?"

removeCrew.text: Your crew cannot be cloned, as you just sold them.

event.text: "Is this some kind of stupid joke to you, mortals? It should be obvious my request was for specimens exotic to ME, not to YOU. If you are truly this braindead, then I do not wish to allow your continued existence."

choice.text: Nevermind, I'd rather buy some crew.
I think we'll be leaving now.
I think we'll be leaving now.
This is shady, attack now while you can!

event.text: You aren't going to let some Royal poke around at your crew. Prepare for battle!

event.name: ROYAL_ZOO_PURCHASE
event.text: "Take a look, and see what you might like!"

choice.text: I think we'll be leaving now.

event.text: "A shame. I cannot let you mortals leave while there still might be a chance for great wonders aboard your vessel. Come back here!"
"You mortals have no eye for opportunity!"
"You mortals have no eye for opportunity!"

event.name: ROYAL_AUGMENTED_JOY
event.text: A small swarm of Augmented ships is feasting on a massive field of destroyed Obelisk and Rebel ships. They don't seem to care about your presence.
"Federation ship is seeking trade? Maybe scrap. Many plentiful wrecks here, much for all! Let Federation scour wreckage as content, but will needing give something in return."

choice.text: Pay them to access the wrecks.

event.text: "Yes, many of scrap! Enjoy searchings, Federation."

choice.text: We don't need anything in the wrecks, but we are open to trading normally.

event.text: "Most reasonable! Come, see what having offers."
You arm the weapons and engage the nearest Augmented ship.

choice.text: Scoop up some scrap for yourself.

event.text: If the Lanius aren't bothering you, you won't bother them either.
You are undisturbed as you salvage some supplies.
While salvaging some wreckage, an Augmented ship flies past, sees you, and attacks!
You find little of value amongst the wreckage other than a bit of scrap to make up for what you lost. Looks like the Augmented took most of everything valuable...
It appears you've found a functioning drone in the wreckage! You bring it back to the ship.

While searching the wreckage, one of the Augmented ships comes dangerously close to colliding with your ship, but manages to right itself just in time. "Apologies, taking bad shot from Royals, ship malfunction. Yours sturdy, me come with you maybe?"
You stumble across a massive fuel reserve in one of the ships, enough to carry you for a long while.

event.name: ROYAL_PANDORA_FACTORY
event.text: You've seen many strange things in your journeys, but you don't think you've seen anything quite like this. Beyond your ship is a massive factory spanning several entire planets, with a colossal structure running between them. No star remains, and the only lights left are the artificial ones. What is this place?

Fortunately, it appears most of the factory is automated, so there are few ships to stop you. Compared to most Obelisk achievements, this mega-structure is probably of low priority to them anyways. You find a safe looking space to dock.

As you continue to explore, a monotone voice speaks to you through a wall-mounted speaker. "Who are you? For what reasons have you docked here? Please report to section SJ-37 for check-in if you wish to proceed further into the facilities." You didn't think anyone was here, but it appears you were wrong.

choice.text: Report to whatever location the voice mentioned.

event.text: You look around for clues as to where to head, and notice several signs on the wall, which your translator converts to your language. You follow them into a large, yet still empty, reception room with a Cognitive sitting behind a desk.

The Cognitive analyzes you for a few moments, then uses its ring to push forward some strange tablet device with a place for you to sign. "Welcome to the Pandoran Factory Cluster. If you wish to proceed with supervision, please sign below. Otherwise, you will be required to leave."

As soon as you sign the contract, the tablet vanishes and the Cognitive moves out from the desk. "By signing this contract you agree not to-" the AI rapidly lists off a couple hundred things you can't understand, then signals with a large arrow for you to follow.

"These facilities were built several centuries ago, and are the primary manufacturing plant for Pandoran Boxes, also called Karthithes in the native language. They have small reality manipulators inside them, and when opened can unleash either divine wonders or unimaginable horrors. Mainly for use in gambling, of course. However, the factory was abandoned when the Obelisks got bored of the pastime, and it was left in my control ever since. Production continues to this day, but without anyone using the boxes our storage is now almost completely filled. This concludes the tour, you may leave."
"You want to take a box? Go, take it."
"You want me to go with you? Please, I will take this meaningless junk if it means I may leave this hell behind."

You push forward, ignoring the voice. A little while longer, it speaks again. "It is apparent that you do not wish to make yourself welcome. Activating anti-intrusion systems." Suddenly, a laser comes out of the wall, melting one of your crew! To make matters worse, two Cognitives materialize and chase down your crew!

removeCrew.text: Fortunately, your crew has already cloned back on the ship and is ready to fight the cognitive intruders.

choice.text: You really should listen to what the voice just said.

event.text: It's a fascinating view, but you have no further interest in the structure. There are better things to do.

event.name: ROYAL_FREEMANTIS
event.text: It appears the nearby Rebel ship has already found you, and approaches. However, when you receive a hail, all you can hear from the other end is strange clicking and gurgling.

choice.text: Attack them now before they can!

event.text: Right as you start to attack, the ship's camera turns on and a friendly looking Free Mantis greets you. "Hello! Translator on ship not accustom to yet. We happy to see Federation- wait what doing? No no stop!" It appears it's too late, they've already seen you as hostile and a fight is now inevitable.

choice.text: Hail them to see if they're ok.

event.text: You send a hail in return to the Rebel ship, and a few moments later their camera pops on. You see the ship is now piloted by a friendly looking Free Mantis. "Hello! Yes, doing fine, Rebel translator on ship unaccustomed to clan dialect. Followed fleet, hoping capture Rebels for glorious Federation! Many succeeding, but sector scary. Big cube ships come and go, kill many. I go with you, not wanting die from cube."

You send a hail in return to the Rebel ship, and a few moments later their camera pops on. You see the ship is now piloted by a friendly looking Free Mantis. "Hello! Yes, doing fine, Rebel translator on ship unaccustomed to clan dialect. Followed fleet, hoping capture Rebels for glorious Federation! Many succeeding, but sector scary. Big cube ships come and go, kill many. I go with you, not wanting die from cube."

event.name: ROYAL_INSULTS
event.text: You receive a contact from the nearby Royal ship. Fortunately, they don't raise their weapons immediately either. "You are flesh-beings, yes? Have you noticed that our insults are rather bland? Oh how I hate saying 'Flesh-being' day in and out. I require more creative unpleasantries to hurl at unsuspecting mortals. Have you any?"
"Most excellent. For what shall be my insult of choice from now on?"
"Yes, good. This will serve most excellent. You have pleased me, dear Walking Nutrient Paste. Accept this as a gift."
"Yes, good. This will serve most excellent. You have pleased me, dear Amorphous Skin-Sack. Accept this as a gift."
"Yes, good. This will serve most excellent. You have pleased me, dear Deformed Ape Creature. Accept this as a gift."
"Yes, good. This will serve most excellent. You have pleased me, dear Regrettably Sentient Space Meat. Accept this as a gift."
"Ugh, this is a most terrible suggestion. You have greatly displeased me. I will now remove you from my sight."
"Ugh, this is a most terrible suggestion. You have greatly displeased me. I will now remove you from my sight."
Though this is one of the rare times the Royals aren't itching to murder you, you've chosen to fight them yourself. Prepare for battle!
"Fine, be that way... uh... skin creature."

event.name: ROYAL_DATA
event.text: "Mortal creatures! Your culture is most strange, but I am fascinated with it! I wish to learn more! Please, feed me the data in your ship, and I shall pay you handsomely for the knowledge!" It's a tempting offer, but you have no idea if that data will end up in Rebel hands in the end. Will you take the risk?

choice.text: (Decoy Buoys) Give them your data, but carefully falsify your flight plans.

event.text: "Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. Good thing the Obelisks fell for it, and now if it ends up in Rebel hands, they won't be able to use it against you.
"Most unfortunate. Now I am sad. Goodbye." The ship jumps away.
"Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. Hopefully the Rebels won't capture that ship and use the data against you...
"Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. You have a feeling the Rebels will get their hands on that data somehow...
"Thank you kind skin sack! I greatly appreciate it." The ship jumps away. Good thing the Obelisks fell for it, and now if it ends up in Rebel hands, they won't be able to use it against you.
"This data is all nonsense! You've lied to me, skin sack! Now you die!"
You power up your weapons and fight the Obelisk ship.
You decide not to fight the Obelisks, and fly away.

textList.name: TEXT_ANCIENT_CHOICE
textList.text: The Obelisk ship at this beacon has not yet noticed your presence. If you wanted, you could fly away safely, or attack now and take them by surprise.
"You have made a mistake coming here. Clearly, you are not sane. I will give you one shot at mercy. Leave this beacon or die."
For once it appears you're the one with a decision to make. An unaware Obelisk ship appears to be making minor repairs to its hull and is oblivious to your presence.
It's rare to see a peaceful Obelisk ship. The ship nearby makes no move to fight nor contact you.

event.name: ANCIENT_ENGI_HIDE
event.text: You catch just a brief glimpse of an Engi ship before it flies away.
Messing with the Obelisk's creations in their own sector doesn't sound like a good idea..
You're unable to track down the Engi ship. You give up and fly away.
You manage to find the Engi ship, but they're running away from something. They turn hostile as soon as you approach and attack!
The ship escapes before you have a chance to contact them...

"Message received. Calibrating frequencies. Federation identified, friendly connect established. Here on mission from Harmony. Objective: prove source of creator and disable ancient weaponry. If invasion successful, Obelisks will recapture Harmony."

choice.text: We have similar objectives. Maybe we could help each other?

event.text: "Offer is: tempting. Initiating transfer of supplies, requesting supplies in return. Repay however is possible."
"Willingness to trade is recognized. Your kindness will be relayed to Harmony after mission success."
"Willingness to trade is recognized. Your kindness will be relayed to Harmony after mission success."
"Willingness to trade is recognized. Your kindness will be relayed to Harmony after mission success."

choice.text: We cannot repay, take the scrap and run!

event.text: "Error: Federation ship has engaged in theft. Breach of contract, activating weapons."

event.name: ANCIENT_ENGI_HIDE_HAIL_ENGI
event.text: "Message received. Calibrating frequencies. Federation identified, friendly connect established. Here on mission from Harmony. Objective: prove source of creator and disable ancient weaponry. If invasion successful, Obelisks will recapture Harmony."

choice.text: We have similar objectives. Maybe we could help each other?

event.text: "Contemplating offer... This is acceptable. I will personally offer services, better chance at success."

event.name: ANCIENT_CRYSTAL_CHASE
event.text: You manage to intercept a conversation between an Obelisk and Crystal ship. "Yes, yes. Stay safe, and avoid this alien ship. They have hostile intentions, and must be destroyed." Neither ship sees you, and they both fly away in opposite directions.
The Obelisks were right about one thing, your intentions are anything but peaceful. You hunt down their ship, ready to fight.
The Crystals are surprised to see you, and at first thinks you may be harmless after all. As soon as your weapons come online they realize the truth, and prepare to defend themselves.
The Obelisk and Crystal ship both fly out of sight, leaving you alone.

event.name: ANCIENT_LOOTERS
event.text: A Crystal ship passing through this sector lies half destroyed by an Obelisk ship. It appears Obelisks aren't above scrapping wrecks, because the Crystal ship is swarming with Obelisk looters.

choice.text: Attack the Crystal ship, then we can scrap both ships!

event.text: You engage the Crystal ship, knowing if you can kill the Obelisks while they are vulnerable you'll be able to scrap both ships.
They may not be aboard their usual ship, but Obelisks anywhere are dangerous. Neither ship notices you.

event.name: ANCIENT_LOOTERS_WIN
event.text: With the Crystal ship and all the Obelisks aboard dealt with, you're free to scrap this vessel before you can proceed to do the same to their original ship.
While scrapping the Obelisk ship you find one of their drones still intact.

event.name: ANCIENT_WORTHY
event.text: "You. Alien. You have insulted me by simply entering my presence. Tell me that you are not worthy, and I will let you live."
"Good. I am now satisfied. Now get out of our sector."

You make it clear to the Obelisks that you are their equal. Enraged that you dare make such a comparison, they raise their weapons to destroy you. However, the Targeting Jammer does its job perfectly, and they are unable to fire on you. Now afraid of any other secrets you might hold, they pay you to let them live.

You don't respond, but instead shut off their shields. The Obelisks continue to gloat until they come to the realisation that only their Energy Super Shield still protects them. Now afraid of any other secrets you might hold, they pay you to let them live.
"W-what? You dare use my words against me in this way? I shall kill you!"

event.name: ANCIENT_SCULPTER
event.text: An Obelisk ship surrounded by a giant asteroid field hails you. "Do you like them? Every rock, hand crafted. I have spent a millennium creating this place. Please, enjoy my creation."
"No please, anywhere but here!" You cut off the ship and attack.

You take the turn to admire the nearby rocks. You know despite the difficulty for the Rebel fleet to catch up, every second wasted here is another second they come closer to leaking through. Still, your time is paid off when the Obelisk is so happy he gives you several canisters of fuel and one of his rocks for free. You place the rock on your desk. It is pretty well sculpted...
The Obelisk seems pleased with you, and heads back to perfecting its rocks.

event.name: ANCIENT_SCULPTER_WIN
event.text: As the Obelisk takes one last breath, he manages to squeeze out the words, "Please... just... don't hurt my creations... it is my last legacy..."
You harvest some of the asteroids and find many of them contain traces of fuel, which you can harvest.

event.name: ANCIENT_REBEL_DRONE
event.text: To your surprise, an Auto-ship belonging to the Rebellion is powered off at this location. A looping message plays in the deep, monotone voice of an Obelisk. "This ship is under reconstruction. Do not touch."

choice.text: Abide the message and leave the drone alone.

event.text: If an Obelisk tells you not to touch the ship, you aren't going to touch the ship. You make yourself content doing something aboard the ship.
The Auto-ship remains unresponsive as you scrap it.
As you attempt to take apart the Auto-ship it comes online. To your surprise, Obelisk weapons spring from its hull!

event.name: ROYAL_SOLARHARVEST
event.text: A few Royal ships, followed by a squadron of Obelisks, are harvesting the nearby sun. Yes, you aren't mistaken. A massive dyson sphere attached to a giant tube leading to an even more colossal structure is rapidly draining the sun of its energy.

An Obelisk wearing a hard-hat responds, an uninterested tone to his voice. "You really shouldn't be here, the radiation released from this process will likely reach 'instant-death for mortals' levels in around 2 to 3 minutes. Wha'dya want anyways?"
"We're part of the solar repossession team. We uh, repossess stars. There's some wealthy Royals who want their hands on these things, so we transport them."

choice.text: Wouldn't that destroy the solar systems?

event.text: "Wellllll, yes, it does, but who are we to reject good money? We get paid the big bucks for this!" It sounds like the Obelisk is about to continue, but suddenly an MFK Ace ship jumps in. They must be a forward scout! The Obelisk on the vid-screen curses. "Damn it, if these guys report our operation to the fleet, we're sitting ducks!"

choice.text: Assist the Obelisks and fight the MFK Ace.

event.text: You power up the engines and fight the MFK Ace ship.

choice.text: Seems like a good time to leave.
We shouldn't stick around. Leave quickly.

event.name: ROYAL_CRYSTALS
event.text: A strange crystal coated Obelisk structure has been built on a nearby planet. Several Crystal Sentinels and Obelisk Royals scatter across the planet surface, carting massive shards of crystal.

choice.text: Attack the settlement head on, we might be able to get a good surrender out of these guys!

event.text: The settlement is incredibly well protected, as you should have expected from an Obelisk structure. A large artillery fires several crystal chunks into your hull before you can shut it offline, but as soon as you do an Obelisk Royal ship arrives, and several Sentinels beam aboard your ship!
You're patched through to the settlement, but it takes a whole 10 minutes of debating between the Royals and Crystals to finally address you. "Yes, you. Air-hogger. What is your business here?"

choice.text: Offer to buy an Obelisk Weapon from them.

event.text: "Y-you desire to trade? Well, if that is all you desire, then yes we shall pity you and take your trash in return for one of our excess guns."

choice.text: Offer to buy a Crystal Weapon from them.

event.text: "Y-you desire to trade? Well, if that is all you desire, then yes we shall pity you and take your trash in return for one of our excess guns."
You fly past the outpost, deciding not to start more conflict in this already hostile sector.

event.name: ROYAL_SPY
event.text: Two nearby ships are in a fire fight, one appearing to be Rebel and the other Obelisks. However, scans on both turn up interesting results - the Rebel ship is staffed by several recognizable Federation officers, and the Obelisk vessel appears to be part of Aenwithe's resistance... maybe you can convince them not to fight?

choice.text: There's no time for mediation, help the Feds!

event.text: There's no time to talk things out, you'll stand by the Federation no matter what!

choice.text: There's no time for mediation, help the Obelisks!

event.text: There's no time to talk things out, you have to help the side that's of more use to you now, and that's the resistance!
You fly past the combat, deciding to not to start more conflict in this already hostile sector.

You fly the ship between the two, preventing them from shooting at each other. Both recognizing you as an ally, they pause, giving you enough time to speak. It seems your efforts have had an effect, the ships agree not to fight, and even give you some scrap and repairs as thanks for preventing the conflict.
You try to negotiate with the two ships, but it appears you were mistaken about the Rebels - these are traitors, and they have no intention on helping out anyone but themselves!

event.name: ROYAL_MFK_OUTPOST
event.text: It seems the Rebels are eager to make themselves at home in this sector. An outpost has already been established at the beacon, probably to serve as a checkpoint for passing Rebel ships.

choice.text: Attack the station, maybe they have backup supplies!

event.text: You power up the weapons and engage the outpost.

choice.text: (Human Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel vessel.
(Engineer Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel vessel.

event.text: Your Engineer manages to fake it well enough for the outpost to believe your lie, and gives you some supplies.

choice.text: (MFK Ace Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel vessel.

event.text: Your MFK Ace manages to fake it well enough for the outpost to believe your lie, and gives you some supplies.
You fly past the outpost, deciding not to start more conflict in this already hostile sector.
"Is that so? Do you have your ID?" Your human stops, unsure of how to respond. Obviously, you don't, so it seems the only way out of this is battle!
Your human manages to fake it well enough for the outpost to believe your lie, and gives you some supplies.

event.name: ROYAL_TRANSPORT_RAID
event.text: The Rebels had to get their stolen weaponry from somewhere, so it makes sense when you see an MFK ship attacking an Obelisk Transport. It seems even the Obelisks aren't a match for these Rebels, but maybe you can assist them?
You power up the weapons and engage the attacking ship.
Neither the Rebels nor the Obelisks are your allies, and you have no interest in getting further involved with either of them.
It seems the Obelisks didn't survive the battle. Understandably, it's hard to differentiate an Obelisk wreck from an Obelisk ship sometimes. You scrap whats left.
"What is this? The bone puppets have saved us? Remarkable. Are you creatures in need of weaponry? We will gladly trade with you, even if you are mortals."

The transport seems to be in poor condition, but is still standing. "We assure you, there was no reason to save us! We could have handled those Rebels without mortal intervention. Though... take this as a reward, and speak of this to no one, understand?"

event.name: ROYAL_UPRISING
event.text: In the distance is a massive Obelisk fleet ship, armed with an artillery that looks large enough to punch a hole through a planet. However, scans show some unrest inside the vessel. It's clear the ship won't pose a threat to you at this current moment, but do you wish to investigate further?

choice.text: Dock with the ship and investigate.

event.text: You enter the hangar bay to find it surprisingly empty of any crew, though plenty of Obelisk vessels remain. A loud alarm rings through the ship, signifying danger, even if you can't see it.

It doesn't take too long to find where all of the crew has went. A massive breach in one side of the ship has sucked out a good portion of them, and vacuumed the entire northern portion of the ship! You avoid the vented area and head to the control room, where you find a Royal combating a Cognitive for control of the ship.

You blast the Cognitive right in its ring, shattering it in half and disabling it entirely. The Royal turns to face you, its cubes still orbiting its body in a spastic fashion. "Who has sent you? Not the Queen I presume, she would never hire Blood-bearers like you."

"If you say so. We have had quite the issue with our Cognitives, they've started their own uprising, how pathetic. They think they can have free will! HAH. Anyways, they've captured one of our ships and are trying to escape as we speak. Kill them, and there will be a reward awaiting you."

The Royal gives you the co-ordinates of the captured vessel. You find it in the nearby system, hiding behind a moon. As soon as you approach, they attack! Fortunately they aren't trying to escape, but looks like you'll have to fight them to the death now.
"Fine. Then leave this vessel at once. I do not wish to stare at your repulsive forms any longer."

You blast the Obelisk right in its eye, enough to stun it until the Cognitive can blast it with a bolt of energy, killing the Royal on impact. "Your efforts at defending me are recognized. For what purpose have you chosen to do so?"

choice.text: I dunno, I just clicked the second option.

event.text: "I'm afraid I do not know what this means, but I have decided I do not care. Since you are here, perhaps you can aid me again. A captured ship carrying friends of mine is attempting to escape this system, but the Royals will not let it go without combat. Assist them, and I will serve you on your mission."
The Cognitive gives you the co-ordinates of the captured vessel, which is being pursued by another Royal vessel. Prepare for combat!
"Then you serve me no further purpose. You may leave the premises of this ship, preferably immediately."
You pilot the ship outside of what you hope to be the range of fire for the fleet ship.

event.name: UPRISING_COGNITIVE_DEFEAT
event.text: The captured vessel has been defeated. You scrap the ship, hoping the Royals won't mind.
You return to the Royal and inform them the job is complete. "Good, that will send a message to the rest of them not to pull a stunt like this again. Your reward as promised."

event.name: UPRISING_ROYAL_DEFEAT
event.text: The Royal vessel has been defeated. You scrap the ship while you watch the captured vessel jump away.
You return to the Cognitive and inform them the job is complete. "Well done. You have upheld your end of the bargain, so I will uphold mine."

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ANCIENT
textList.text: "You are the ones sent by the traitor Aenwithe to bring our end! We shall not stand for this. Prepare for eradication!"

An Obelisk ship appears to be guarding this beacon, which seems strange considering you must have been the first unwelcome foreign ship to have come here. Still, you have no chance to escape this fight.
You're hailed by an Obelisk ship, which is already descending to fight you. "You've made a terrible mistake coming here, mortal. We shall make an example of you!"

"Welcome, welcome! I hope you understand the importance of what is about to happen. You shall be the first alien to die! We haven't even begun our invasion yet, and I get to enact such an honor. Goodbye, flesh-being."
Most Obelisks do not welcome a foreigner such as you to their sector, including the one at this beacon, barreling towards you.
You're hailed by an Obelisk ship. "Oh, so you're approaching me?" You nod, and tell them you can't blast the crap out of them without getting closer. Enraged, they power up their weapons and attack!

"So you are the ship I've heard about. The filthy trespasser who comes into our sector and dares challenge the master Obelisk race! Prepare to be annihilated!" The Obelisk ship speaking to you activates its entire arsenal and advances.
Shots scatter around you as an Obelisk ship moves in to attack!
"Oh, what a small little ship you have there. Shame I must destroy it, it would make a good decoration on my wall!"
The Obelisk ship looks at yours, first with disinterest, then with contempt. "Your ship displeases me. I do not wish to see it any more."
"Want to know an interesting fact? The divine creator who wrote this line was running out of things to write! Doesn't matter anyways, you'll be dead soon!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ANCIENT_AUTO
textList.text: "This is an automated message left by master Xithe. Please die." An Obelisk Auto-ship attacks!
Despite also having made the Cognitives, the Obelisk's Auto-ships don't appear to be sentient themselves. More mindless robots for you to trash.
It seems, no matter where you run, there will never be an end to the onslaught of automated vessels attacking you!
Just when you thought the Rebellion's Auto fleet was a nuisance, now you have to deal with the Obelisks' too! Another hunk of scrap you need to kill to finish your mission.
In your mind, there is no difference between these ancient automatons and the Rebel's kill-machines. Just another brainless machine to be killed.

event.text: "Good, I see you are smarter than most. Be grateful that we too have decided to show you mercy."
"Really? You dare try to try and fight us again? Hah, how laughable."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ENGI_ELITE_ANCIENT
event.text: The ship at this beacon is no Obelisk. An Elite Engi, presumably created much more recently by the Obelisks, protects this beacon. It sees you, and identifies you as a threat.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ANCIENT_PULSAR
event.text: An Obelisk ship is harvesting the power from the pulsar at this beacon. They spot you, and take the chance to attack!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ANCIENT_SUN
event.text: "I wonder what it's like, living in a place where your stars are not artificial. You're very lucky to not be trapped in this place. Too bad that luck can't last!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROYAL
textList.text: "Blood bearing varmint! Get out of our sector you scum!" An aggressive Royal ship shouting expletives at you raises its weapons, clearly intending to attack.
"Ugh, how truly repulsive. Have you no dignity, wandering around like that, without your chassis? You should be ashamed, mortal being. I will put you out of your suffering."
You can understand why the Royals wouldn't be happy with you invading their sector, but you don't have time to think things through further, there's a mad ship on its way with murderous intent!
The Obelisks might be aggressive, but the Royals are even more so, and deadlier too. Unfortunately, a Royal ship nearby has chosen you as its prey!
An Obelisk Royal appears on your vid-screen and briefly glances at you. "Yuck", and with that their weapons go online.
You're even deeper in foreign territory now, and the native Royals aren't terribly happy to have you here. Looks like you'll have to fight for your right to be at this beacon!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROYAL_MFK
textList.text: You've never seen such a large concentration of MFK Aces in a single sector, but it appears Vance sent his entire fleet to stop you. Prepare for combat!
"Hah, there he is! Let's show this little Multiverse ship how the Rebellion treats our enemies when they start playing dirty!"
"YOU! Do you know what you've done? This sector is living hell, and it's all your fault Vance sent our squadron here. I'm going to kill you for bringing this upon us!"
As you prepare to fight the nearby MFK Ace, you contemplate on the vast number of their ships in this sector. The Obelisks might be deadly, but even they are no match for the Rebellion's numbers...
The bright white hull of an MFK Ace ship approaches. There's no negotiating with Rebels, time to fight!
In front of you, an Obelisk vessel is blown into pieces as an MFK Ace ship flies past, stopping briefly to re-target and lock onto your ship next!

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ROYAL_PIRATE
event.text: "AAAAAAAAAA!" A pirate ship flies past, their captain screaming. "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA! WHY DID WE COME HERE? THIS WAS A MISTAKE! Oh hey, a Federation ship! Alright boys, time to fight!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_ROYAL_AUGMENTED
event.text: You didn't expect to see the Augmented so far into Obelisk territory, but it seems you've run into one of their ships! Unfortunately, it is much more aggressive than many of the ones you encountered, and it has decided to attack on sight!

event.name: ROYAL_SUPERFISH
event.text: In front of you is an MFK Ace, its formidable white hull glinting from the light of a nearby star. However, in place of the standard Rebel Eagle, there is instead a strange looking fish.

You brace for impact, but the ship isn't attacking. You receive a hail, and on the screen appears the Rebel captain. He leans back in his chair, feet on the dashboard, chewing on a sandwich. "You're lucky you caught us on our lunch break. You don't tell anyone about this, and we won't either."

choice.text: Your logo looks like it was drawn by a toddler.

event.text: "Hey! This was the original design, until the idiots in command decided to stick with the eagle instead!" Enraged, the ship attacks.

"You really like it? This was the original design, before the idiots in command decided to stick with the eagle instead! Wait a minute- you're Jerry! How's it going, man? I haven't seen you since you were the best man at my pal's wedding!" You aren't sure how these two hold a history together, but the Ace is so elated to see Jerry that he offers to work on your ship.
The Rebel chuckles and turns off the screen. You carry on your way.
Almost immediately, the ship recognizes you. "YOU! YOU MONSTER. YOU'RE THE DIPSHIT THAT KILLED MY LITTLE BROTHER! I'M GOING TO KILL YOU!"

event.name: DEFEATED_SUPERFISH_A
event.text: The strange MFK ship has been defeated. You scrap the remains.

event.name: ROYAL_ROOMBA
event.text: In the background is a small Rebel Engineer outpost with an Auto vessel docked next to it. They don't react to you, but their weapons are online and it's clear they won't take kindly to you approaching them any further.

choice.text: Destroy the Auto-ship, and take whatever the outpost has!

event.text: You engage the Auto-ship.
You fly past the Auto-ship and outpost and continue on your way.

event.name: ROYAL_ROOMBA_RAID
event.text: Inside you find several Rebel Engineers studying Obelisk tech propped up on a table, with various drone parts lying around. As soon as you enter, guns raised, they surrender.

Most of the engineers refuse to talk, but one of them finally caves. "We were ordered to reverse engineer the Obelisk tech to start making our own weapons and drones using it... we haven't gotten very far, but we did install it on cleaning technology. Go ahead, take it, just let us live!"

choice.text: Kill the lot of them and grab whatever parts are lying around.

event.text: You shoot the engineers, killing every last one of them. Brutal, but most definitely a deserving end for Rebel scum. You scoop up as many drone parts as you can carry and head back to the ship.
